Package cmsanalysis¶

This package implements the main execution logic of processing and post-processing. The modules and a short description is given in the table below.

sample for sample definition
cmsrunprocess management of a single cmsRun process
controller parallel execution of the cmsRun processes
postprocessing post proc logic and base class
main puts it all together

Sample¶

class cmstoolsac3b.sample.Sample[source]¶

Collect information about a sample. Subclass!

Samples have to be declared by subclassing. Example:

class SomeSample(Sample):
    input_files = [common_input_path + "data/dir/*.root"]
    lumi        = 4700.
    output_file = common_output_path
    legend      = "Data"

For a full example of all features see Sample Definition.

cmstoolsac3b.sample.load_samples(module)[source]¶

Adds samples to samples list in settings.

Parameters:module (module) – modules to import samples from
Returns:dict of sample classes
cmstoolsac3b.sample.generate_samples(in_filenames, in_path='', out_path='')[source]¶

Generates samples and adds them to settings.samples.

The input filename without suffix will be taken as sample name.

Parameters:
  • in_filenames – names of inputfiles
  • in_path – input path
  • out_path – output path
Returns:

dict of sample classes
cmstoolsac3b.sample.generate_samples_glob(glob_path, out_path)[source]¶

Globs for files and creates according samples.

CmsRunProcess¶

class cmstoolsac3b.cmsrunprocess.CmsRunProcess(sample_inst, try_reuse_old_data=False, cfg_filename=None)[source]¶

This class hosts a cmsRun process. cmsRun output is streamed into logfile.

prepare_run_conf()[source]¶

Takes all infos about the cmsRun to be started and builds a configuration file with python code, which is passed to cmsRun on calling start(). Conf-file stored in settings.DIR_CONFS.

write_job_info(exit_code)[source]¶

Writes start- and endtime as well as exitcode to the process info file in settings.DIR_JOBINFO. If self.sigint is true, it does not write anything.

check_reuse_possible()[source]¶

Checks if log, conf and file service files are present and if the process was finished successfully before. If yes returns True, because the previous results can be used again.

start()[source]¶

Start cmsRun with conf-file. If self.try_reuse is True and reuse is possible, just calls ‘cmsRun –help’ and pipes output to /dev/null.

terminate()[source]¶

Overwrites terminate method, set’s flag for infofile first, then calls terminate.

Controller¶

class cmstoolsac3b.controller.Controller[source]¶

Generates, starts and finishes crp.CmsRunProcesses.

setup_processes()[source]¶

crp.CmsRunProcesses are set up, and filled into self.waiting_pros crp.CmsRunProcess.prepare_run_conf() is called for every process.

start_processes()[source]¶

Starts the queued processes.

finish_processes()[source]¶

Remove finished processes from self.running_pros.

PostProcessing¶

class cmstoolsac3b.postprocessing.PostProcTool[source]¶

Base class for post processing tool.

A directory in <settings.DIR_PLOTS> with the class name of this tool is created. Messages can be printed with self.message().

wanna_reuse(all_reused_before_me)[source]¶

Overwrite! If True is returned, run is not called.

run()[source]¶

Overwrite!

class cmstoolsac3b.postprocessing.PostProcessor(all_processes_reused)[source]¶

Executes PostProcTools.

run()[source]¶

All tools in tool chain are executed.

Main¶

cmstoolsac3b.main.main(post_proc_tool_classes=[], not_ask_execute=False, logfilename='cmstoolsac3b.log', **settings_kws)[source]¶

Post processing and processing.

Parameters:
  • post_proc_tool_classes (list) – PostProcTool subclasses.
  • not_ask_execute (bool) – Suppress command line input check before executing the cmsRun processes.
  • logfilename (string) – name of the logfile. No logging if None .
  • settings_kws – settings parameters given as keyword arguments are added to settings, e.g. samples={"mc":MCSample, ...} .
cmstoolsac3b.main.standalone(post_proc_tool_classes, **settings_kws)[source]¶

Runs post processing alone.

Parameters:
  • post_proc_tool_classes – list of PostProcTool subclasses.
  • settings_kws – settings parameters given as keyword arguments are added to settings, e.g. samples={"mc":MCSample, ...} .
